thread.title: Ron Paul aide guilty in payoff, another acquitted
thread.title_full: Ron Paul aide guilty in payoff, another acquitted - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Ron Paul aide guilty in payoff, another acquitted
text:
SAM HARREL/AP An aide to Ron Paul’s 2012 presidential campaign was convicted and another aide was aquitted. Charles Dharapak/AP Iowa State Senator Kent Sorenson speaks at a rally for Republican presidential candidate, Rep. Ron Paul, at the Iowa State Fair Grounds in Des Moines, Iowa. Previous Next Enlarge DES MOINES — An aide to Ron Paul’s 2012 presidential campaign was convicted Thursday of one of five charges he faced related to secret payments to an Iowa lawmaker, and jurors acquitted a second aide of making false statements to the FBI.
The federal jury found Dimitri Kesari guilty of causing the campaign to file false records concerning the payments to former Iowa State Sen. Kent Sorenson. He was acquitted of an obstruction of justice charge.
Co-defendant Jesse Benton was acquitted of the false statements to the FBI charge, the only one he faced at trial. Benton was the former campaign chairman during Paul’s run for President and Kesari was a deputy campaign manager.
Related Stories Ron Paul Channel launches Ron Paul defends son Rand against Chris Christie Ron Paul to make acting debut in 'Atlas Shrugged III'
